arguments.question: What is the process for employee performance‑review appeals?

messages.content: Summarizing the clause for quick reference...

arguments.text: Employees may submit an appeal within 10 business days of receiving their performance review outcome. Appeals must be submitted in writing to the HR Department and include a justification and any supporting documentation. HR will acknowledge receipt within 3 business days and schedule a review meeting with the employee’s manager and a neutral senior leader. The decision on the appeal will be communicated within 15 business days after the meeting. Appeals are final and non‑escalable.

messages.content:
- Submit an appeal in writing within 10 business days of the review outcome.
- Include justification and supporting documents.
- HR acknowledges receipt within 3 business days and arranges a meeting with the manager and a neutral senior leader.
- Decision communicated within 15 business days after the meeting.
- The appeal decision is final.

### Performance Review Appeals Process (Section 5.3, Policy PERF‑REV‑2023)

**Exact clause:**

> Employees may submit an appeal within 10 business days of receiving their performance review outcome. Appeals must be submitted in writing to the HR Department and include a justification and any supporting documentation. HR will acknowledge receipt within 3 business days and schedule a review meeting with the employee’s manager and a neutral senior leader. The decision on the appeal will be communicated within 15 business days after the meeting. Appeals are final and non‑escalable.

**Summary:**

- File a written appeal within 10 business days.
- Provide justification and supporting docs.
- HR acknowledges within 3 business days and sets up a review meeting.
- Final decision delivered within 15 business days after the meeting.
- The decision is final and cannot be escalated further.
